üí†The Bierpinsel(also known as beer brush), is a 47 meter high building in Steglitz (Berlin). The building's name came from the Berlin slang and was built in a form that resembles a tree. Opened in 1976, it was used as a restaurant.

@BrandenburgHist @LandonSystems @weserubung Zehlendorf is the only neighborhood worth living in Berlin but it's pretty expensive now. Small towns like Colmberg are pretty affordable if you want to live in Germany and still be able to take a bus or train to cities. Everything is expensive now.
